ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. It worth to take. It will help us know the contemporary archaeological theory systematically.
"ARCG748 is a review of popular theoretical frameworks since 1960 until now." I think this class is absolutely necessary for any archaeologist.

Summary: This class will give you an insight of archaeological theory from processualism to the present day, through reading and debate. Be prepared do do a lot of reading that will not always be easy to understand but necessary to your growth as an archaeologist. I would recommend this as a MUST for any archaeology student, and maybe do those who study physical anthropology (if they study cultures/people of the past) I would not recommend this to someone who is simply interested in archaeology as a side.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The class will allow me to consider the many ways to view the archaeological record, which will make my dissertations a more well-rounded, well-argued piece.
This course was crucial to deepening my knowledge of my discipline and will be integral to my dissertation research.
